caption_text: Fig. 1. Overview of the foot-controlled robotic endoscope teleoperation system. (a) Master console and surgeon. (b) Slave surgical robot systems, one for
the endoscope and one for the two endoscopic instruments.
Fig. 2. Mapping natural foot motions to control the (a) ﬂexible endoscope in
four DoFs of (b) Up/down bending, (c) left/right bending, (d) translation and
(e) rotation. (Right foot is illustrated here).
Fig. 3. Robotic endoscope system in (a) perspective view. Exposed view of (b) bending module (BM), (c) rotation module (RM) and (d) translation module
(TM).
Fig. 4. Robotic instruments of grasper (left) and monopolar cauterizing hook
(right).
Fig. 6. Endoscope motion study (a) set up and (b) angle calculation.
Hysteresis proﬁles of the endoscope in (c) L/R direction and (d) U/D direction.
Fig. 5. Master interfaces with (a) hand interface and (b) foot interface.
Fig. 7. Four-DoF motion control demonstrated with the foot, foot-controlled interface, and the endoscope. (a) Up-down bending DoF. (b) Left-right bending
DoF. (c) Rotation DoF. (d) Translation DoF.
Fig. 8. Hand clutch buttons.
Fig. 9. Ex vivo test setup. (a) Master console. (b) Slave robotic system. (c) Surgical instruments and working tissue.
Fig. 10. Surgical operation of (a)(b)exposed and (c)(d) covered targets viewed
from top camera and endoscope camera. Cutting result for (e) exposed and
(f) covered targets.
Fig. 11. Results: (a) completion time and (b) questionnaire.
